intro: Chrysactinia pinnata, commonly known as the silverleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its silvery, fuzzy leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Chrysactinia pinnata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
